alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Crawford; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 15 at 3:06PM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Much of central Illinois, east central Illinois and southeast Illinois east of I-55. This including the following counties, in central Illinois, Christian, Macon, Piatt and Shelby. In east central Illinois, Champaign, Clark, Coles, Cumberland, Douglas, Edgar, Moultrie and Vermilion. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain will begin moving into the area Wednesday evening, and will continue much of Thursday before changing over to freezing rain north of I-70. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are likely during this period, with the heaviest amounts just north of I-70. With the deeper ground still frozen, much of this rain will run off into area streams and rivers.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Crawford; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland; Shelby
